body.p: We Thomas E Bramlette Captain of Home Guards, of Adair Co. principle T. T. Alexander, Eli Wheat, C. F. Epperson, Richd Garnett G. R. Page

sureties -- undertake that Thomas E Bramlette shall safely keep & return to the State Arsenal at Frankfort at the expiration of five years or sooner if his company be dissolved all the Arms which may be drawn by him as Captain of the Home Guard aforesaid or make compensation to the Commonwealth of Kentucky for a failure and to the extent of any failure so to do this 1st June 1861.

Tho. E. Bramlette
R. T. Garnett
T T Alexander
Geo, R, Page
Chas F Epperson
Eli Wheat

attest
E. T Willis P J A C. C

I E. T. Willis Presiding Judge of the Adair County Court, certify that a Company of Home Guards was this day organized in Adair County at the Court house, in Columbia, and the officers were all duly elected in my presence & under my supervision. Thos E Bramlette was duly elected Captain. The officers & men took the Oath prescribed by the act entitled "An act for the regulations & to provide for the army of the state" "approved May 24th 1861".

The said Thos. E Bramlette extends bond as required by the act aforesaid which he certify to be a good bond & the surety sufficient to secure the performance of this covenant or to answer for the breach,
Given under my hand this 1st day of June, 1861
E. T Willis. P. J. A. C. C

For Captain Tho. E. Bramlette
1st Lieutenant John. R. Wheat
2nd
